title: [Large-Scale] Tutorial Action Plan (TAPdis) Simulation Training for Disability Translation: Strengthening Social Inclusivity

context.prior_knowledge: Basic translation/interpretation theory and practical experience, foundational understanding of the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD) and social inclusion concepts
context.additional_context: Implementation of translation scenarios tailored to disability characteristics and strengthening practical competencies. The curriculum integrates elements of improving social relationships, including intercultural communication, citizen participation, and overcoming institutional barriers.

learning_goals: Learners can explain ≥3 translation strategies from a social inclusion perspective tailored to diverse disabilities (visual, auditory, motor impairments).
Learners can complete a VR simulation-based translation quality checklist from the disabled person’s perspective with ≥80% accuracy, incorporating cultural rights considerations.
Learners can propose ≥2 customized support plans applicable to workplace settings using the TAPdis framework, including civic engagement and accessibility policy improvements.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
